steps: Add fresh lemon juice, passion fruit puree, spiced rum, simple syrup, and Angostura bitters into a shaker filled with ice.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a thin lemon wheel and a small sprig of mint.
drink_image_description: A vibrant cocktail in a coupe glass featuring a bright yellow-orange hue from passion fruit and lemon, garnished with a fresh lemon wheel and mint sprig, shot with soft natural lighting highlighting condensation on the glass, set against a bright, airy background.
drink_history: This cocktail was invented as a playful twist on the classic sour with tropical passion fruit and the warming spice of rum, designed to deliver a fruity yet bold sipping experience.

flavor_profile.mouthfeel: Smooth with a slight syrupy texture
flavor_profile.finish: Lingering spicy warmth with refreshing citrus brightness
flavor_profile.balance: Well balanced between sour, sweet, and spice

serving_size_base.batch_preparation_notes: Multiply all ingredients by the number of servings, shake in batches, and strain individually.

enhanced_steps.action: Add fresh lemon juice, passion fruit puree, spiced rum, simple syrup, and Angostura bitters into a shaker filled with ice.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use freshly squeezed lemon juice for the best tartness; add ice to the shaker to chill the ingredients evenly.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Watch for the frosty appearance on the outside of the shaker as it chills.
common_mistakes: Using bottled lemon juice which lacks freshness
enhanced_steps.timing_guidance: Fill shaker about halfway with ice.

enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Shake for about 15 seconds to ensure proper dilution and chilling.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Shaker becomes cold and slightly frosty.
common_mistakes: Not shaking hard enough to chill
enhanced_steps.timing_guidance: Aim for 15 seconds of vigorous shaking.

enhanced_steps.action: Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Use a fine strainer to catch any pulp or ice shards for a smooth texture.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Clear, vibrant liquid without ice shards in the glass.

enhanced_steps.action: Garnish with a thin lemon wheel and a small sprig of mint.
enhanced_steps.technique_detail: Cut the lemon wheel thinly for elegance and place the mint sprig upright for visual appeal.
enhanced_steps.visual_cue: Fresh, bright garnish enhancing the drink's presentation.

suggested_variations.name: Spicy Tropical Zest Kick
changes: Add a slice of fresh jalapeño to the shaker
Use overproof rum for extra kick
suggested_variations.description: This variation adds a fresh spicy heat that complements the tropical fruit and citrus.

suggested_variations.name: Tropical Zest Fizz
suggested_variations.description: A lighter, bubbly version perfect for warm weather sipping.

drink_trivia.fact: Passion fruit adds a unique tropical twist that enhances the classic sour profile.
Spiced rum was originally developed in the Caribbean to mask imperfections in early rum batches with warming spices.
Coupe glasses were popular in the early 20th century and have seen a resurgence as a stylish serving option for cocktails.
